properties.Name: PartyLocation

Columns.Name: PartyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Party.

Columns.Name: LocationTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location Type.

Columns.Name: LocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartTimestamp
Columns.Description: The period start timestamp associated with the information.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndTimestamp
Columns.Description: The period end timestamp associated with the information.

Columns.Name: GlobalLocationNumber
Columns.Description: The Global Location Number (GLN) is a simple tool used to uniquely identify locations. It can be used to identify physical locations such as a warehouse, legal entities, or a function / department within a legal entity. The GLN is part of the GS1 system of standards.

Columns.Name: PreferenceId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Preference.

Columns.Name: PartyLocationNote
Columns.Description: A note, comment or additional information regarding a Party Location.

Properties.Description:
The party(s) located at the associated Location.   

The intent of this relationship is to illustrate that based upon the relationship between a Party and a Location and the purpose of that location (LOCATION TYPE) then any number of geographic measurements can be added to LOCATION and used to provide or infer information about the Party at that Location.

Additional foreign key relationships can be added to LOCATION to extend and enhance the information therein.  In this model only the most significant relationships have been drawn, which show up as foreign key relationships in LOCATION.

This same concept can be applied to any geographic - Party - Location relationship.
